etymology.description: semantic: 行(行) (xíng, 'go') + phonetic: 圭(圭) (guī) = walking path + phonetic element -> street
etymology.interpretation: The character 街(街) (jiē, 'street') combines 行(行) (xíng, 'go'), which suggests a path or place for walking, with 圭(圭) (guī) as a phonetic component, indicating the pronunciation. This reflects the concept of a street as a place for passage.

examples.chinese: 我走在热闹的街上(我走在熱鬧的街上)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zǒu zài rè nào de jiē shàng.
examples.english: I walk on a bustling street.

examples.chinese: 夜幕降临时(夜幕降臨時)，街边灯火辉煌(街邊燈火輝煌)。
examples.pinyin: Yèmù jiànglín shí, jiē biān dēng huǒ huī huáng.
examples.english: When night falls, the street lights shine brightly.
